alert.note: Alert for Chester; York (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 06 at 12:30PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A THUNDERSTORM WITH TORRENTIAL RAINFALL WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN CHESTER AND SOUTH CENTRAL YORK COUNTIES UNTIL 100 PM EST... At 1229 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with torrential rainfall 4 miles west of Chester, or 4 miles northwest of Chester State Park, moving northeast at 15 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Chester, Mcconnells, Richburg, Lowrys and Chester State Park. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
